config_v3.title: config
config_v3.description: Configuration options for Doc Detective operations.

input.description: Path(s) to test specifications and documentation source files. May be paths to specific files or to directories to scan for files.

output.description: Path of the directory in which to store the output of Doc Detective commands. If a file path is specified, Doc Detective attempts to honor the file name specified, but file path behavior is controlled by the configured reporters.

recursive.description: If `true` searches `input`, `setup`, and `cleanup` paths recursively for test specifications and source files.

relativePathBase.description: Whether paths should be interpreted as relative to the current working directory (`cwd`) or to the file in which they're specified (`file`).

loadVariables.description: Path to a `.env` file to load before performing a Doc Detective operation.

origin.description: Default protocol and domain to use for relative URLs.

beforeAny.description: Path(s) to test specifications to perform before those specified by `input`. Useful for setting up testing environments.

afterAll.description: Path(s) to test specifications to perform after those specified by `input`. Useful for cleaning up testing environments.

detectSteps.description: Whether or not to detect steps in input files based on defined markup.

logLevel.description: Amount of detail to output when performing an operation.

runOn.description: Contexts to run the test in. Overrides contexts defined at the config and spec levels.

oneOf.title: context
oneOf.description: A context in which to perform tests. If no contexts are specified but a context is required by one or more tests, Doc Detective attempts to identify a supported context in the current environment and run tests against it. For example, if a browser isn't specified but is required by steps in the test, Doc Detective will search for and use a supported browser available in the current environment.

httpRequest.title: httpRequest
httpRequest.description: Perform a generic HTTP request, for example to an API.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: URL for the HTTP request.

allOf.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

allOf.title: Operation ID
allOf.description: Operation ID from the OpenAPI schema. Only valid if the OpenAPI description path is specified elsewhere and the operation ID is unique among all specified OpenAPI descriptions.

allOf.title: openApi
allOf.description: OpenAPI description and configuration.

name.description: Name of the OpenAPI description, as defined in your configuration.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI description.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

server.description: Server to use for example requests. Only valid if `useExample` is `request` or `both`. If not specified but an example is used for the request, uses the first server defined in the OpenAPI description.

validateAgainstSchema.description: Validates the request and/or response against the schema in the OpenAPI description. If the request or response doesn't match the schema, the step fails.

mockResponse.description: If `true`, doesn't make the HTTP request, but instead uses the response example or schema from the OpenAPI description as the response data. Useful for creating tests when an API isn't fully implemented yet. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code.

statusCode.description: Response code to use for validation, examples, and status code checking. If the response code doesn't match, the step fails. `statusCodes` overrides this value when specified.

useExample.description: Uses the example from the OpenAPI description as the request and response data. If the request or response has multiple examples, specify `exampleKey`. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code. `requestData`, `requestParams`, and `requestHeaders` override portions of request examples when specified. `responseData` overrides portions of response examples when specified.

exampleKey.description: Key of the example to use from the `examples` property in the OpenAPI description. If an `examples` key isn't specified or isn't available for a given parameter or object, the `example` property value is used.

headers.description: Request headers to add to requests. For example, to set `Authorization` headers for all requests from the specified OpenAPI document. If specified in both a config and a step, the step value overrides the config value.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI description.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

timeout.description: Timeout for the HTTP request, in milliseconds.

headers.description: Headers to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

parameters.description: URL parameters to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

body.description: JSON object to include as the body of the HTTP request.

headers.description: Headers expected in the response, in key/value format. If one or more `responseHeaders` entries aren't present in the response, the step fails.

body.description: JSON object expected in the response. If one or more key/value pairs aren't present in the response, the step fails.

allowAdditionalFields.description: If `false`, the step fails when the response data contains fields not specified in thr response body.

path.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `directory`. Specify a file extension that matches the expected response type, such as `.json` for JSON content or `.txt` for strings.

directory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `path`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `path` if it exists.
If `aboveVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `path` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

allOf.description: OpenAPI description and configuration.

name.description: Name of the OpenAPI description, as defined in your configuration.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI description.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

server.description: Server to use for example requests. Only valid if `useExample` is `request` or `both`. If not specified but an example is used for the request, uses the first server defined in the OpenAPI description.

validateAgainstSchema.description: Validates the request and/or response against the schema in the OpenAPI description. If the request or response doesn't match the schema, the step fails.

mockResponse.description: If `true`, doesn't make the HTTP request, but instead uses the response example or schema from the OpenAPI description as the response data. Useful for creating tests when an API isn't fully implemented yet. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code.

statusCode.description: Response code to use for validation, examples, and status code checking. If the response code doesn't match, the step fails. `statusCodes` overrides this value when specified.

useExample.description: Uses the example from the OpenAPI description as the request and response data. If the request or response has multiple examples, specify `exampleKey`. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code. `requestData`, `requestParams`, and `requestHeaders` override portions of request examples when specified. `responseData` overrides portions of response examples when specified.

exampleKey.description: Key of the example to use from the `examples` property in the OpenAPI description. If an `examples` key isn't specified or isn't available for a given parameter or object, the `example` property value is used.

headers.description: Request headers to add to requests. For example, to set `Authorization` headers for all requests from the specified OpenAPI document. If specified in both a config and a step, the step value overrides the config value.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI description.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

timeout.description: Timeout for the HTTP request, in milliseconds.

parameters.description: URL parameters to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

body.description: JSON object to include as the body of the HTTP request.

body.description: JSON object expected in the response. If one or more key/value pairs aren't present in the response, the step fails.

allowAdditionalFields.description: If `false`, the step fails when the response data contains fields not specified in thr response body.

path.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `directory`. Specify a file extension that matches the expected response type, such as `.json` for JSON content or `.txt` for strings.

directory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `path`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `path` if it exists.
If `aboveVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `path` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

httpRequest.description: Perform a generic HTTP request, for example to an API.

anyOf.title: URL
anyOf.description: URL for the HTTP request.

allOf.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

allOf.title: Operation ID
allOf.description: Operation ID from the OpenAPI schema. Only valid if the OpenAPI description path is specified elsewhere and the operation ID is unique among all specified OpenAPI descriptions.

allOf.title: openApi
allOf.description: OpenAPI description and configuration.

name.description: Name of the OpenAPI description, as defined in your configuration.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI description.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

server.description: Server to use for example requests. Only valid if `useExample` is `request` or `both`. If not specified but an example is used for the request, uses the first server defined in the OpenAPI description.

validateAgainstSchema.description: Validates the request and/or response against the schema in the OpenAPI description. If the request or response doesn't match the schema, the step fails.

mockResponse.description: If `true`, doesn't make the HTTP request, but instead uses the response example or schema from the OpenAPI description as the response data. Useful for creating tests when an API isn't fully implemented yet. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code.

statusCode.description: Response code to use for validation, examples, and status code checking. If the response code doesn't match, the step fails. `statusCodes` overrides this value when specified.

useExample.description: Uses the example from the OpenAPI description as the request and response data. If the request or response has multiple examples, specify `exampleKey`. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code. `requestData`, `requestParams`, and `requestHeaders` override portions of request examples when specified. `responseData` overrides portions of response examples when specified.

exampleKey.description: Key of the example to use from the `examples` property in the OpenAPI description. If an `examples` key isn't specified or isn't available for a given parameter or object, the `example` property value is used.

headers.description: Request headers to add to requests. For example, to set `Authorization` headers for all requests from the specified OpenAPI document. If specified in both a config and a step, the step value overrides the config value.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI description.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

timeout.description: Timeout for the HTTP request, in milliseconds.

headers.description: Headers to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

parameters.description: URL parameters to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

body.description: JSON object to include as the body of the HTTP request.

headers.description: Headers expected in the response, in key/value format. If one or more `responseHeaders` entries aren't present in the response, the step fails.

body.description: JSON object expected in the response. If one or more key/value pairs aren't present in the response, the step fails.

allowAdditionalFields.description: If `false`, the step fails when the response data contains fields not specified in thr response body.

path.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `directory`. Specify a file extension that matches the expected response type, such as `.json` for JSON content or `.txt` for strings.

directory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `path`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `path` if it exists.
If `aboveVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `path` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

config_v2.title: config
config_v2.description: Configuration options for Doc Detective operations.

defaultCommand.description: Default command to run when no command is specified.

input.description: Path(s) to test specifications and documentation source files. May be paths to specific files or to directories to scan for files.

output.description: Path of the of the file or directory in which to store the output of Doc Detective commands. If a file path is specified, the output is written to that file. If a file of that name already exists, Doc Detective creates appends an integer to the result file name. If a directory path is specified, the output file name is dependent on the command being run.

recursive.description: If `true` searches `input`, `setup`, and `cleanup` paths recursively for test specificaions and source files.

relativePathBase.description: Whether paths should be interpreted as relative to the current working directory (`cwd`) or to the file in which they're specified (`file`).

envVariables.description: Path to a `.env` file to load before performing a Doc Detective operation.

runTests.description: Options for running tests. When running tests, values set here override general configuration options.

input.description: Path(s) to test specifications and documentation source files. May be paths to specific files or to directories to scan for files.

output.description: Path of the of the file or directory in which to store the output of Doc Detective commands. If a file path is specified, the output is written to that file. If a file of that name already exists, Doc Detective creates appends an integer to the result file name. If a directory path is specified, the output file name is dependent on the command being run.

setup.description: Path(s) to test specifications to perform before those specified by `input`. Useful for setting up testing environments.

cleanup.description: Path(s) to test specifications to perform after those specified by `input`. Useful for cleaning up testing environments.

recursive.description: If `true` searches `input`, `setup`, and `cleanup` paths recursively for test specificaions and source files.

detectSteps.description: Whether or not to detect steps in input files based on markup regex.

downloadDirectory.description: Path of the directory in which to store downloaded files.

contexts.description: Application/platform sets to run tests in. If no contexts are specified but a context is required by one or more tests, Doc Detective attempts to identify a supported context in the current environment and run tests against it.

oneOf.title: context
oneOf.description:
An application and supported platforms.

If no contexts are specified but a context is required by one or more tests, Doc Detective attempts to identify a supported context in the current environment and run tests against it. For browsers, context priority is Firefox > Chrome > Chromium.

name.description: Name of the application.

path.description: Absolute path or command for the application. If not specified, defaults to typical install paths per platform. If specified but the path is invalid, the context is skipped.

options.description: Options to pass to the app. Only works when `name` is `firefox` or `chrome`.

width.description: Width of the window in pixels.

height.description: Height of the window in pixels.

viewport_height.description: Height of the viewport in pixels. Overrides `height`.

viewport_width.description: Width of the viewport in pixels. Overrides `width`.

headless.description: If `true`, runs the browser in headless mode. Not supported by Safari.

driverPath.description: Path to the browser driver. If not specified, defaults to internally managed dependencies.

runCoverage.description: Options for performing test coverage analysis on documentation source files.  When performing coveration analysis, values set here override general configuration options.

input.description: Path(s) to test specifications and documentation source files. May be paths to specific files or to directories to scan for files.

output.description: Path of the of the file or directory in which to store the output of Doc Detective commands. If a file path is specified, the output is written to that file. If a file of that name already exists, Doc Detective creates appends an integer to the result file name. If a directory path is specified, the output file name is dependent on the command being run.

recursive.description: If `true` searches `input`, `setup`, and `cleanup` paths recursively for test specificaions and source files.

markup.description: Markup types to include when performing this operation. If no markup types are specified, the operation includes all markup types as defined in `fileTypes`.

suggestTests.description: Options for suggesting tests based on documentation source files.  When suggesting tests, values set here override general condiguration options.

markup.description: Markup types to include when performing this operation. If no markup types are specified, the operation includes all markup types as defined in `fileTypes`.

fileTypes.description: Information on supported file types and how to parse the markup within them.

name.description: Name of the file type.

extensions.description: File extensions to support with this configuration.

testStartStatementOpen.description: Opening of an in-document test start statement.

testStartStatementClose.description: Close of an in-document test start statement.

testIgnoreStatement.description: Text for an in-document test ignore statement.

testEndStatement.description: Text for an in-document test end statement.

stepStatementOpen.description: Opening of an in-document step statement.

stepStatementClose.description: Close of an in-document step statement.

markup.description: Markup types and associated regex patterns to find in documentation source files.

name.description: Name of the markup type.

regex.description: Regex patterns to find the markup type in documentation source files.

actions.description: Actions that apply to the markup type.

name.description: Name of the action.

oneOf.title: checkLink
oneOf.description: Check if a URL returns an acceptable status code from a GET request.

origin.description: Protocol and domain to navigate to. Prepended to `url`.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

oneOf.title: find
oneOf.description: Check if an element exists with the specified CSS selector.

selector.description: Selector that uniquely identifies the element.

timeout.description: Max duration in milliseconds to wait for the element to exist.

matchText.description: Text that the element should contain. If the element doesn't contain the text, the step fails. Accepts both strings an regular expressions. To use a regular expression, the expression should start and end with a `/`. For example, `/search/`.

moveTo.description: Move to the element. If the element isn't visible, it's scrolled into view. Only runs the if the test is being recorded.

typeKeys.description: Type keys after finding the element. Either a string or an object with a `keys` field as defined in [`typeKeys`](typeKeys). To type in the element, make the element active with the `click` parameter.

delay.description: Delay in milliseconds between each key press. Only valid during a recording.

setVariables.description: Extract environment variables from the element's text.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

regex.description: Regex to extract the environment variable from the element's text.

oneOf.title: goTo
oneOf.description: Navigate to a specified URL.

origin.description: Protocol and domain to navigate to. Prepended to `url`.

oneOf.title: httpRequest
oneOf.description: Perform a generic HTTP request, for example to an API.

allOf.title: openApi
allOf.description: OpenAPI definition and configuration.

name.description: Name of the OpenAPI definition, as defined in your configuration.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI definition.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

server.description: Server to use for example requests. Only valid if `useExample` is `request` or `both`. If not specified but an example is used for the request, uses the first server defined in the OpenAPI definition.

validateAgainstSchema.description: Validates the request and/or response against the schema in the OpenAPI definition. If the request or response doesn't match the schema, the step fails.

mockResponse.description: If `true`, doesn't make the HTTP request, but instead uses the response example or schema from the OpenAPI definition as the response data. Useful for creating tests when an API isn't fully implemented yet. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code.

statusCode.description: Response code to use for validation, examples, and status code checking. If the response code doesn't match, the step fails. `statusCodes` overrides this value when specified.

useExample.description: Uses the example from the OpenAPI definition as the request and response data. If the request or response has multiple examples, specify `exampleKey`. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code. `requestData`, `requestParams`, and `requestHeaders` override portions of request examples when specified. `responseData` overrides portions of response examples when specified.

exampleKey.description: Key of the example to use from the `examples` property in the OpenAPI definition. If an `examples` key isn't specified or isn't available for a given parameter or object, the `example` property value is used.

requestHeaders.description: Request headers to add to the request. If specified in both a config and a step, the step value overrides the config value.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

timeout.description: Timeout for the HTTP request, in milliseconds.

requestHeaders.description: Headers to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

responseHeaders.description: Headers expected in the response, in key/value format. If one or more `responseHeaders` entries aren't present in the response, the step fails.

requestParams.description: URL parameters to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

requestData.description: JSON object to include as the body of the HTTP request.

responseData.description: JSON object expected in the response. If one or more key/value pairs aren't present in the response, the step fails.

allowAdditionalFields.description: If `false`, the step fails when the response data contains fields not specified in `responseData`.

savePath.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `saveDirectory`. Specify a file extension that matches the expected response type, such as `.json` for JSON content or `.txt` for strings.

saveDirectory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `savePath`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if it exists.
If `byVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

envsFromResponseData.description: Environment variables to set based on response variables, as an object of the environment variable name and the jq filter applied to the response data to identify the variable's value.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

jqFilter.description: jq filter to apply to the response data. If the filter doesn't return a value, the environment variable isn't set.

oneOf.title: runShell
oneOf.description: Perform a native shell command.

command.description: Command to perform in the machine's default shell.

exitCodes.description: Expected exit codes of the command. If the command's actual exit code isn't in this list, the step fails.

output.description: Content expected in the command's output. If the expected content can't be found in the command's output (either stdout or stderr), the step fails. Supports strings and regular expressions. To use a regular expression, the string must start and end with a forward slash, like in `/^hello-world.*/`.

savePath.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `saveDirectory`.

saveDirectory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `savePath`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if it exists.
If `byVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

timeout.description: Max time in milliseconds the command is allowed to run. If the command runs longer than this, the step fails.

setVariables.description: Extract environment variables from the command's output.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

regex.description: Regex to extract the environment variable from the command's output.

oneOf.title: saveScreenshot
oneOf.description: Takes a screenshot in PNG format.

path.description: File path of the PNG file, relative to `directory`. If not specified, the file name is the ID of the step.

directory.description: Directory of the PNG file. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of pixels between the new screenshot and the exisitng screenshot at `path`. If the difference between the new screenshot and the existing screenshot is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If a screenshot doesn't exist at `path`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing screenshot at `path` if it exists.
If `byVariation`, overwrites the existing screenshot at `path` if the difference between the new screenshot and the existing screenshot is greater than `maxVariation`.

selector.description: Selector of the element to crop the image to.

oneOf.description: Padding in pixels to add to the bounds of the element.

path.description: Path to the `.env` file.

path.description: File path of the recording. Supports the `.mp4`, `.webm`, and `.gif` extensions. If not specified, the file name is the ID of the step, and the extension is `.mp4`.

directory.description: Directory of the file. Attempts to create the directory if it doesn't exist.

overwrite.description: If `true`, overwrites the existing file at `path` if it exists.

oneOf.description: Stop the current recording.

oneOf.description: Type keys. To type special keys, begin and end the string with `$` and use the special key's enum. For example, to type the Escape key, enter `$ESCAPE$`.

context_v2.title: context

An application and supported platforms.

path.description: Absolute path or command for the application. If not specified, defaults to typical install paths per platform. If specified but the path is invalid, the context is skipped.

options.description: Options to pass to the app. Only works when `name` is `firefox` or `chrome`.

width.description: Width of the window in pixels.

height.description: Height of the window in pixels.

viewport_height.description: Height of the viewport in pixels. Overrides `height`.

viewport_width.description: Width of the viewport in pixels. Overrides `width`.

headless.description: If `true`, runs the browser in headless mode. Not supported by Safari.

driverPath.description: Path to the browser driver. If not specified, defaults to internally managed dependencies.

file.description: Path to the file that the test is associated with.

detectSteps.description: Whether or not to detect steps in input files based on markup regex. Defaults to `true`.

contexts.description: Application/platform sets to run the test in. Overrides `contexts` defined at the config-level and spec-level.

oneOf.title: context
oneOf.description:
An application and supported platforms.

If no contexts are specified but a context is required by one or more tests, Doc Detective attempts to identify a supported context in the current environment and run tests against it. For browsers, context priority is Firefox > Chrome > Chromium.

name.description: Name of the application.

path.description: Absolute path or command for the application. If not specified, defaults to typical install paths per platform. If specified but the path is invalid, the context is skipped.

options.description: Options to pass to the app. Only works when `name` is `firefox` or `chrome`.

width.description: Width of the window in pixels.

height.description: Height of the window in pixels.

viewport_height.description: Height of the viewport in pixels. Overrides `height`.

viewport_width.description: Width of the viewport in pixels. Overrides `width`.

headless.description: If `true`, runs the browser in headless mode. Not supported by Safari.

driverPath.description: Path to the browser driver. If not specified, defaults to internally managed dependencies.

allOf.title: openApi
allOf.description: OpenAPI definition and configuration.

name.description: Name of the OpenAPI definition, as defined in your configuration.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI definition.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

server.description: Server to use for example requests. Only valid if `useExample` is `request` or `both`. If not specified but an example is used for the request, uses the first server defined in the OpenAPI definition.

validateAgainstSchema.description: Validates the request and/or response against the schema in the OpenAPI definition. If the request or response doesn't match the schema, the step fails.

mockResponse.description: If `true`, doesn't make the HTTP request, but instead uses the response example or schema from the OpenAPI definition as the response data. Useful for creating tests when an API isn't fully implemented yet. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code.

statusCode.description: Response code to use for validation, examples, and status code checking. If the response code doesn't match, the step fails. `statusCodes` overrides this value when specified.

useExample.description: Uses the example from the OpenAPI definition as the request and response data. If the request or response has multiple examples, specify `exampleKey`. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code. `requestData`, `requestParams`, and `requestHeaders` override portions of request examples when specified. `responseData` overrides portions of response examples when specified.

exampleKey.description: Key of the example to use from the `examples` property in the OpenAPI definition. If an `examples` key isn't specified or isn't available for a given parameter or object, the `example` property value is used.

requestHeaders.description: Request headers to add to the request. If specified in both a config and a step, the step value overrides the config value.

operationId.$commment: Only allow operationId at the step level.

setup.description: Path to a test specification to perform before this test, while maintaining this test's context. Useful for setting up testing environments. Only the `steps` property is used from the first test in the setup spec.

cleanup.description: Path to a test specification to perform after this test, while maintaining this test's context. Useful for cleaning up testing environments. Only the `steps` property is used from the first test in the cleanup spec.

steps.description: Actions to perform as part of the test. Performed in the sequence defined. If one or more actions fail, the test fails.

anyOf.title: checkLink
anyOf.description: Check if a URL returns an acceptable status code from a GET request.

origin.description: Protocol and domain to navigate to. Prepended to `url`.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

anyOf.title: goTo
anyOf.description: Navigate to a specified URL.

origin.description: Protocol and domain to navigate to. Prepended to `url`.

anyOf.title: httpRequest
anyOf.description: Perform a generic HTTP request, for example to an API.

allOf.title: openApi
allOf.description: OpenAPI definition and configuration.

name.description: Name of the OpenAPI definition, as defined in your configuration.

descriptionPath.description: URL or local path to the OpenAPI definition.

operationId.description: ID of the operation to use for the request.

server.description: Server to use for example requests. Only valid if `useExample` is `request` or `both`. If not specified but an example is used for the request, uses the first server defined in the OpenAPI definition.

validateAgainstSchema.description: Validates the request and/or response against the schema in the OpenAPI definition. If the request or response doesn't match the schema, the step fails.

mockResponse.description: If `true`, doesn't make the HTTP request, but instead uses the response example or schema from the OpenAPI definition as the response data. Useful for creating tests when an API isn't fully implemented yet. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code.

statusCode.description: Response code to use for validation, examples, and status code checking. If the response code doesn't match, the step fails. `statusCodes` overrides this value when specified.

useExample.description: Uses the example from the OpenAPI definition as the request and response data. If the request or response has multiple examples, specify `exampleKey`. If `statusCode` isn't specified, uses the first defined response code. `requestData`, `requestParams`, and `requestHeaders` override portions of request examples when specified. `responseData` overrides portions of response examples when specified.

exampleKey.description: Key of the example to use from the `examples` property in the OpenAPI definition. If an `examples` key isn't specified or isn't available for a given parameter or object, the `example` property value is used.

requestHeaders.description: Request headers to add to the request. If specified in both a config and a step, the step value overrides the config value.

statusCodes.description: Accepted status codes. If the specified URL returns a code other than what is specified here, the action fails.

timeout.description: Timeout for the HTTP request, in milliseconds.

requestHeaders.description: Headers to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

responseHeaders.description: Headers expected in the response, in key/value format. If one or more `responseHeaders` entries aren't present in the response, the step fails.

requestParams.description: URL parameters to include in the HTTP request, in key/value format.

requestData.description: JSON object to include as the body of the HTTP request.

responseData.description: JSON object expected in the response. If one or more key/value pairs aren't present in the response, the step fails.

allowAdditionalFields.description: If `false`, the step fails when the response data contains fields not specified in `responseData`.

savePath.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `saveDirectory`. Specify a file extension that matches the expected response type, such as `.json` for JSON content or `.txt` for strings.

saveDirectory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `savePath`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if it exists.
If `byVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

envsFromResponseData.description: Environment variables to set based on response variables, as an object of the environment variable name and the jq filter applied to the response data to identify the variable's value.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

jqFilter.description: jq filter to apply to the response data. If the filter doesn't return a value, the environment variable isn't set.

anyOf.title: runCode
anyOf.description: Assemble and run code.

language.description: Language of the code to run. If not specified, the code is run in the shell.

exitCodes.description: Expected exit codes of the command. If the command's actual exit code isn't in this list, the step fails.

output.description: Content expected in the command's output. If the expected content can't be found in the command's output (either stdout or stderr), the step fails. Supports strings and regular expressions. To use a regular expression, the string must start and end with a forward slash, like in `/^hello-world.*/`.

savePath.description: File path to save the command's output, relative to `saveDirectory`.

saveDirectory.description: Directory to save the command's output. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory. If not specified, the directory is your media directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of text different between the current output and previously saved output. If the difference between the current output and the previous output is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If output doesn't exist at `savePath`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if it exists.
If `byVariation`, overwrites the existing output at `savePath` if the difference between the new output and the existing output is greater than `maxVariation`.

timeout.description: Max time in milliseconds the command is allowed to run. If the command runs longer than this, the step fails.

setVariables.description: Extract environment variables from the command's output.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

regex.description: Regex to extract the environment variable from the command's output.

outputs.description: Outputs from step processes and user-defined expressions. Use the `outputs` object to reference outputs in subsequent steps. If a user-defined output matches the key for a step-defined output, the user-defined output takes precedence.

^[A-Za-z0-9_]+$.description: Runtime expression for a user-defined output value.

anyOf.description: Perform a native shell command.

command.description: Command to perform in the machine's default shell.

exitCodes.description: Expected exit codes of the command. If the command's actual exit code isn't in this list, the step fails.

output.description: Content expected in the command's output. If the expected content can't be found in the command's output (either stdout or stderr), the step fails. overwrite.description:

setVariables.description: Extract environment variables from the command's output.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

regex.description: Regex to extract the environment variable from the command's output.

anyOf.title: saveScreenshot
anyOf.description: Takes a screenshot in PNG format.

path.description: File path of the PNG file, relative to `directory`. If not specified, the file name is the ID of the step.

directory.description: Directory of the PNG file. If the directory doesn't exist, creates the directory.

maxVariation.description: Allowed variation in percentage of pixels between the new screenshot and the exisitng screenshot at `path`. If the difference between the new screenshot and the existing screenshot is greater than `maxVariation`, the step fails. If a screenshot doesn't exist at `path`, this value is ignored.

overwrite.description:
If `true`, overwrites the existing screenshot at `path` if it exists.
If `byVariation`, overwrites the existing screenshot at `path` if the difference between the new screenshot and the existing screenshot is greater than `maxVariation`.

selector.description: Selector of the element to crop the image to.

oneOf.description: Padding in pixels to add to the bounds of the element.

anyOf.title: setVariables
anyOf.description: Load environment variables from a `.env` file.

path.description: Path to the `.env` file.

anyOf.title: startRecording
anyOf.description: Start recording the current browser viewport. Must be followed by a `stopRecording` action. Only runs when the context `app` is `chrome` and `headless` is `false`. Supported extensions: [ '.mp4', '.webm', '.gif' ]

path.description: File path of the recording. Supports the `.mp4`, `.webm`, and `.gif` extensions. If not specified, the file name is the ID of the step, and the extension is `.mp4`.

directory.description: Directory of the file. Attempts to create the directory if it doesn't exist.

overwrite.description: If `true`, overwrites the existing file at `path` if it exists.

anyOf.title: stopRecording
anyOf.description: Stop the current recording.

anyOf.title: typeKeys
anyOf.description: Type keys. To type special keys, begin and end the string with `$` and use the special key's enum. For example, to type the Escape key, enter `$ESCAPE$`.

delay.description: Delay in milliseconds between each key press. Only valid during a recording.

anyOf.title: find
anyOf.description: Check if an element exists with the specified CSS selector.

selector.description: Selector that uniquely identifies the element.

timeout.description: Max duration in milliseconds to wait for the element to exist.

matchText.description: Text that the element should contain. If the element doesn't contain the text, the step fails. Accepts both strings an regular expressions. To use a regular expression, the expression should start and end with a `/`. For example, `/search/`.

moveTo.description: Move to the element. If the element isn't visible, it's scrolled into view. Only runs the if the test is being recorded.

typeKeys.description: Type keys after finding the element. Either a string or an object with a `keys` field as defined in [`typeKeys`](typeKeys). To type in the element, make the element active with the `click` parameter.

delay.description: Delay in milliseconds between each key press. Only valid during a recording.

setVariables.description: Extract environment variables from the element's text.

name.description: Name of the environment variable to set.

regex.description: Regex to extract the environment variable from the element's text.

anyOf.title: wait
anyOf.description: Pause before performing the next action.
